(In reply to comment #0)
> 3. I get
>  java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaUI
> 
> I did not install any specific java package, I have the default java version on
> my machine
> java --version
> java version "1.5.0"
> gij (GNU libgcj) version 4.2.1 (Ubuntu 4.2.1-5ubuntu5)
> 
...
> 
> Should I install another version of Java ?

Yes.  GCJ isn't a supported runtime.  Please retry with a supported Java runtime as listed at http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/development/eclipse_project_plan_3_3.html#TargetOperatingEnvironments

As Nitin said,

Please retry with a supported Java
runtime as listed at
http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/development/eclipse_project_plan_3_3.html#TargetOperatingEnvironments
